column1: round the wicket, on a length outside off, cracked cover
very gentle barley spinning offspin outside off, chopped towards point
a low full toss, driven past cover to long-off
almost top edges to short fine leg! Attempts a paddle-sweep from well outside off
and now plays and misses as he drives at a wider delivery. That turned
gets enough on this! Connects with a slog sweep and sends it over a leap mid-on
back of a length at off stump, pulled crisply to midwicket
a straighter delivery, worked to the left of mid-on
a big appeal for lbw as he falls across this, but looks to have pitched outside leg...was quite short
a shorter delivery, pulled through midwicket without much timing
moves well outside leg stump, Bird follows him and Wade clubs through midwicket
a bouncer, very short, and it's called wide
short on leg stump, gets across the crease and inside the line then pulls to long leg
length ball on the pads, tucked to deep square leg
slips this down the leg side
on the stumps, good length, pushed towards mid-on
another one down the leg side, the wide count already growing
moves to the leg side this time, would have been another wide if he'd stood still, heaves it to mid-on
full outside off, that's a nice drive square through the off side
dropped by a diving Seb Gotch! A short-of-a-length delivery, Short swings across the line, gets a big top edge which Gotch can't grab left-handed above his head
tight to off stump, dropped towards backward point
another appeal for lbw as Wade misses his work across the line but it again pitched outside leg
tucks a length delivery off the pads to long leg
down the leg side, another wide
back of a length at off stump, played into the off side
another one takes the pad as Short looks to work to the leg side, rebounds towards backward point
gets a long way across the crease and again can't get this through the leg side, not offering any width
short outside leg stump, a nicely controlled hook which goes straight to long leg
appeal for a catch down the leg side...nothing doing, just takes the thigh pad. Maintaining the leg-stump line
he starts to shape to scoop this from outside off but adjusts at the last moment and angles to short third man
full and straight, tucked into midwicket
short, down the leg side, rolls his wrists and pulls it very fine
straight down the ground this time, full outside off, strikes through the line back over the bowler's head
full again, at off stump, drives along the ground this time and finds mid-on
flicked off the pads to long leg
crunches a drive towards mid-on, can't quite beat the fielder as Maddinson comes across
full at the pads, Short doesn't make contact as he aims to flick it away
full and straight, the bat twists in his hands and the ball goes into midwicket without much power
this is short at leg stump, a good-looking pull from Wade is placed wide of long leg
moves away to the leg side, it's a back-of-a-length delivery, square driven firmly to point...there's a direct but Wade looks safe
full and straight, driven to long-off
beats the top edge as Short goes for the square cut...touch of extra bounce
a fuller delivery and it gets dispatched straight down the ground, he stayed in his crease and just hit through the line
waits for this to turn away outside off and guides to short third man
full, pushed down the leg side, he sweeps strongly but it's a misfield at deep square that allows the boundary
short outside off, he swings and misses
loops it up outside off and is launched over long-off...that's a tough welcome to the BBL
plays over the top of a very full delivery outside off
a length delivery, he comes down the pitch and works towards long-on...the weight of shot allows for the second
short outside off, a googly which turns away further, square driven to deep point
full outside off, left alone looking for the wide call but it doesn't come
driven along the ground to cover...he recovered well after that first-ball six
round the wicket, starts with a bouncer, goes over the top edge as Short pulls
short again, outside off, dragged out to deep square leg
full and straight, he's across his crease and flicks to long-on
a slower ball, pitches outside leg stump, takes the pad into the leg side
a short delivery, pulled into the leg side and deep midwicket can't stop the second
gets the yorker in, dug out to the on side and Bravo cuts across from his follow through
round the wicket, floated up full and drilled straight down the ground. Stand and deliver
big full toss wide outside off, awful ball, driven very powerfully towards cover who can't stop it cleanly
full and straight, worked into midwicket
gets forward and plays with an open face into point
pushed off the back foot down the ground to long-off
moves outside leg, Dunk follows him and it's driven to long-off
driven to the off side
into the pads, placed nicely between deep square and deep midwicket
full outside leg stump, swept to fine leg...poor delivery
this spins away sharply and beats a booming drive, good take from Gotch who goes for the stump...the back foot was briefly out of the crease but he got it back in time
a full delivery and gets pumped well over long-on...that was right in the slot for Short
flicked into the leg side, out to deep square
over the wicket, short outside off, driven to deep cover
dropped at deep midwicket as Wade picks this up from outside off, aims for one of the longest boundaries, Gulbis gets there but is on the move and can't hold on

well caught this time! A parried effort on long-off rope by Dunk...Wade drilled this down the ground, but it was struck quite flat - bowled much slower - Dunk judged were he was perfectly, held the catch then tossed it up as he went across the boundary before regathering it
flicks a low full toss from outside off to deep midwicket
touch shorter outside off, cut to deep point
again bowled quite slowly, almost through the shot as he goes for the sweep but gets it into square leg
works a length delivery into midwicket...fifty off 33 balls
full and straight, driven to mid-off
that's a fantastic shot, a lofted cover drive through the off side
back-to-back boundaries as he flicks a length ball beautifully through midwicket and it's a no-ball to boot. Oh boy, that's nowhere near a no-ball! There's been some poor umpiring in last few nights
length ball, dragged through the leg side
plays and misses as he drives, through to the keeper
full at off stump, a slightly slower ball, driven to the covers
what a shot! Moves outside leg stump, it's a length ball, he drives it well clear of mid-off without over-hitting
short outside off, just manages to ramp this over short third man and backward point
short of a length and crunched! That sat up very nicely, Short had all the time in the world as he hammered the pull well in front of square
short of a length outside leg, tucked through square and the placement is excellent
fuller at the stumps, driven firmly straight down the ground but long-on can get across
slower ball, full at the pads, clipped off the toes and again weighted perfectly for the second...that was a very classy over of batting
has he got enough on this? No in every sense! Spins away as he aims to loft straight down the ground, miscues and it falls short of long-off
that's a huge loopy full toss, pulled to deep square and a no-ball
dragged down short and quick outside off, sliced over cover
he's nailed that! Superb crisp footwork as he comes down the pitch and plays a magnificent lofted shot straight down the ground
stays in the crease this time and hammers a length ball straight down the ground, excellent work from long-off to keep this inside the rope
leading edge back to the bowler as he gets squared up trying to work this into the leg side, face of the bat closed and Bowe just about hangs on
full outside off, flicked into midwicket
good length, straight, tucked to midwicket
full at off stump, pushed back to the bowler...already some pressure on McDermott
walks down the pitch, misses his flick, a big appeal for lbw...was a long way down the crease, but it was pretty straight. Going just over the stumps
length ball, straight, clubbed down to long-on
comes down the pitch, swings and misses, skims past off stump and Gotch can't gather it cleanly. McDermott made that into a yorker
full outside off, driven back at the bowler and it's another dot. Superb effort from Gulbis
and now he's going! He heard...a full, straight delivery. McDermott stays still and launches it over long-on into the netting behind the sightscreen
swings a length delivery off the stumps to deep square and there's a run for the arm as well
connects very well again! A slower ball outside off, this basically as slog-sweep and has the legs to clear a long boundary at deep midwicket
banged in back of a length, a short-arm pull to deep midwicket and it's hard to stop the twos on a huge outfield
back of a length, might have been a cutter, beats the top edge as McDermott pulls
that's hit very hard, but the pull goes straight to deep square
a wide yorker, crunched back at Bravo who gets smashed on the ankle and he's in some pain
a slower ball, short of a length, sent to deep midwicket
very wide outside off, McDermott reaches it and drags down to long-on
dropped, but that would have been a stunning catch! A leg-stump yorker, flicked back towards Bravo who almost pulls off a miraculous caught and bowled diving to his left
this has been given leg byes, a leg stump yorker which gets deflected to fine leg...it's come straight off the toe of the bat
slower ball, short of a length, he's through the shot early and gets a toe end back to Bravo

dropped, but that would also have been an magnificent catch...McDermott comes down the pitch and swings towards deep midwicket. Gulbis does very well to prevent the boundary by palming the ball back in
gets a bottom edge on this pull
for a second that looked huge as he swung to the leg side, but he didn't get all of it and it ends up falling short of deep midwicket and long-on...confusion between the fielders
big full toss wide outside off, sliced to deep cover... Plunkett saw him shaping for the leg side again
pulled through the leg side
full, wide outside off, sliced in the air over backward point to third man. He's into the 90s but won't have the strike
full, drilled straight back at the bowler...well stopped by Bravo
keeps it full outside off, opens the face and steers it between third man and deep point
full and straight, swings across the line and gets an inside edge into his back pad
gets the yorker in again, clipped through midwicket and he can get back for the strike (will Short end up four short?)
comes down the pitch outside leg stump, heaved out to deep midwicket. Not out of the middle
it was on a length! But Short can only swing it down to long-on...so he ends on 96 and there was that four given as leg byes!
over the wicket, full and straight, pushed towards mid-off and there's a tight single
good length at off stump, tucked into midwicket
just gets enough on this lofted drive to clear mid-off, certainly not struck cleanly
good length on off stump, clubbed into the leg side
full at off stump, driven towards mid-off who is deep enough to allow the single
very full at off stump, pushed into the covers
strikes first ball! Gulbis gives himself room to the leg side, misses his square cut and the top of off stump is clipped
nicely off the mark first ball, overpitched outside off, he comes forward and drives square through the off side
straighter delivery, on the stumps, worked to midwicket
round the wicket, low straight full toss, he tries the reverse paddle-sweep and finds short third man
back into the crease, works a straight delivery to deep square leg
full at off stump, played back down the pitch
full at off stump, gets forward and it's a punchy on-drive but he can't beat mid-on
round the wicket, good length outside off, gets a thick inside edge which scoots past the stumps to fine leg
back of a length, punched off the back foot to cover
huge appeal for lbw as he works across the line of a delivery angled in from round the wicket...looked a but high
fuller, at the pads, clipped to long leg
over the wicket, angled into the pads, worked to deep square leg
short of a length outside off, goes under the bottom edge as Dunk aims to pull
on the pads, flicked in the air backward of square and that's placed very well
that's a massive top edge over the keeper...and goes all the way! A back-of-a-length delivery, Dunk swings across the line and gets full value in a completely different direction to where he aimed
fuller, at the stumps, skewed into midwicket and just short of the fielder
back of a length at off stump, played into midwicket
short outside off, ramped down to third man
starts with a short delivery and is dispatched through midwicket with a thumping front-foot pull
short again, outside off this time, 138kph and beats the top edge as Larkin goes for the cut
short of a length, straight, dabbed into the backward point area
charges down the pitch and swings across the line of a short-of-a-length delivery, it's another top edge over the keeper!
back of a length on leg stump, takes the pad into square leg
pulled to short fine leg! A well-directed short ball, cramped Larkin for room, at the body, he goes for the pull and can't keep it down. Was onto him too quickly
short of a length outside off, this may have taken a bottom, doesn't reach Wade on the full
good length at middle and off, punchy drive to mid-off
back of a length, 147kph, at off stump, defended towards point
gives himself a touch and slices a short-of-a-length delivery between the men either side of backward point
over the wicket, short on off stump, moves to leg and tries to go over the off side...beats the top edge
short at the body, leg-stump line, hits him on the chest and rolls to short fine leg...aggressive stuff from the Hurricanes
dragged on! Short can do no wrong tonight...a short of a length delivery outside off, Dunk goes for the cut and gets a bottom edge onto off stump
short outside off, driven to deep cover
goes deep in the crease and whips from outside off to long-on
full at middle and leg, uses his feet and flicks along the ground through midwicket
full outside off, worked through the leg side. Almost confusion over a second
dragged down short, pulled to long-on
full and straight, worked to deep midwicket
given lbw, that's a big wicket! Round the wicket, a full and straight delivery, Maddinson plays across it and is taken on the back leg in front of all three
works a straight delivery into the leg side
looks to whip through the on side and is taken on the pads
flicks a straight delivery off the stumps into square leg
length ball outside off, pushed into the on side and Botha can't cut it off
full at leg stump, flicked off the pads
goes for the slog sweep, takes it from outside off stump, rolls towards deep square leg
short outside off, cracked from the back foot to deep cover and a misfield allows the second
full toss down the leg side, lap-swept into Wade I think and it bounces away
full outside off, driven to short third man
comes down the pitch, is done in the flight but gets a thick outside edge which goes fine of short third man
eases a straight delivery into the leg side
short of a length, pushed into square leg
this straightens onto leg stump, played down the ground to long-on
full, pushed back to the bowler
down the pitch and flicks off the stumps to long-on
worked off the pads...this isn't doing much damage to the Hurricanes
cross-seamer, full and straight, takes a thick outside to backward point as he drives
short of a length at off stump, a perfect back-foot defensive shot from Bravo
short of a length, straight, tucked to mid-on...three dot balls to start the over
touch fuller, outside off at 143kph, worked into midwicket
that's a ripper! Good length outside off, 146kph, Gotch moving across his crease and is then beaten on the inside edge as the ball nips back
short of a length at off stump, jumps behind the line and nudges to mid-on. Terrific over
and he's sent straight down the ground over the sightscreen first ball
length ball outside off, waits a fraction longer then opens the face and beats short third man. Lovely bit of touch
this one skids a touch lower, heading for the stumps, cut to deep cover
stand and deliver! This is brute force from Bravo as he strikes through the line of a length delivery outside off and sends it straight down the ground
flatter, at the stumps, pushed to the on side
worked into midwicket to end a productive over
short of a length, pulled straight down the ground...Stars getting going

straight up the air and taken! Bravo cut-off just as he was promising...Meredith went fuller, 145kph, and Bravo tried to go straight down the ground, lost his shape and it was a simple catch for Archer at mid-off
full and straight, tucked to deep square
short of a length, straight, worked off the hip to deep square
pulled to deep square leg
fuller, at the stumps, worked backward of square
backs away to leg and gets a bottom edge
that's nicely bowled, much slower and it grips, spins and beats the inside edge
short outside leg stump, pulled behind square
pulled from outside off down the ground
round the wicket, outside off, worked into square leg
taken off the stumps towards long-on and that's good running
short of a length, straight, worked into midwicket
loses control as he swings across the line of a short-of-a-length delivery and Botha settles underneath it
full and straight, driven sweetly to mid-on
a bouncer over leg stump, called wide
short of a length at off stump, pulled into midwicket
full and straight, driven in the air and it's just short of mid-off
shorter outside off, pulled to deep midwicket but not really out of the middle
swings hard outside off and gets a thick outside edge wide of the keeper to third man
slower ball outside off, played down to long-on
back-of-the-hand slower and it's nailed along the ground through the covers, wide of the sweeper. Terrific shot
length ball into the pads, worked into midwicket
comes down the pitch and drives down to long-off
short of a length and swung out to deep midwicket
finds deep square leg as Plunkett picks him out as he pulls a short-of-a-length delivery
nips back and takes the back leg
full outside off, drilled to mid-off
direct hit from Rose! Superb piece of work. Was given into the covers, a sliding save and he throws while kneeling on the ground with one-and-a-half stumps to aim at
caught at long leg...another for Meredith as he bangs in a short ball at 145kph, Bird hooks and gets a top edge, neatly taken coming in by Archer
goes for the yorker, low full toss outside off, driven to backward point
cleaned him up! At that's a good way to finish things. A yorker from Archer...well, actually, Bowes has smashed the stumps himself as he's gone so far back in his crease.
